title: Can I get 90+ in class 12 if I didn't study well in class 11? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is easy to score 90+ marks in class 12th there are only few rules which need to be followed RELIGIOUSLY. The rules are simple but tough to follow bcoz we are not in habit of accepting things as they are we have the habit of overthinking and doing the things in a manner in which we try to mould the basic rules in order to make them effective in our own manner without realizing the importance of some basic principles such as regularity, diligence and self regulation….. Some basic rules to be followed are mentioned below and remember the adage ‘IT IS EASIER SAID THAN DONE’ Remember the famous saying that ‘TALK DOES NOT COOK RICE’ so stop planning and start implementing.It is never to late to start the right thing in the right manner here i would like to insist on the right manner which means start with small targets but with perfection , never try to overburden youself with huge targets which are tough to be achieved bcoz it may lead to procastination which will ultimately lead to losing your motivation for your goal.Make a habit of doing at least 5 questions in your major subject (5*3=15 questions) on daily basis in a different notebook and stay focussed.These 15 questions should become part of your routine and there should not be a single day on which you should skip doing these questions and try to do atleast these 15 questions with whole hearted effort never ever skip them and take them for granted and plan to do them on the next day, it can lead you in a disastrous state of procastination and planning. Stay focussed.Once you have overcome your above state and have started doing the work in the best possible form then your SELF MOTIVATION is going to inctease and you will start enjoying your work.Your confidence level is going to get a boost bcoz of your regularity and perfection in your work as a result your performance is going to increase which will lead to an increase in your SELF ESTEEM.Once you are tuned into the process of regularity than your desire for doing more is going to increase and your quest for doing more is going to increase and it would be a process of self induction.After following the process for 3 (safer side)months your grades are surely going to surely shoot up. As psychology reveals that if we do a task for 8 weeks it becomes part of habit.This is how we can train our brains into the process of self regulation but remember one thing before believing in a principle we need to have complete faith in the principle.This is how we can bring out the best in ourself and achieve 90+ marks in our board exams.The only one precaution which needs to be taken care off is you need to believe in yourself and follow the above principle RELIGIOUSLY.Thank you for reading and you will be more thankful to yourselves if you apply it bcoz always remember ‘IT IS EASIER SAID THAN DONE’Regards, Career mate keep learning Once

Yes u can do !!!! It won't be very tough. U just need to increase the hours u study, boost your confidence and believe in yourself that u can . U may follow these small advices :- As u didn't study well in 11 , then to get the habit of studying for long hours would be difficult initially . So take short breaks in between but don't do anything distractive in the break this will make it difficult for u return back to study .Also try to increase the study hours gradually .Try to concentrate may be by listening to calm music or by meditation …Check your progress through any kind of class test etc that happens in school or tuition . Give those test honestly and prepare for it dilligently . Even if u have improved a little from class XI it should be a huge positive point for u . After giving two or three such test , if u find yourself improving then , be confident that u are on the right track . Thus continue walking on that path with all your energy and enthusiasm . Be regular with your studies . Be regular to school and coaching . Don't take unnecessary leave . Don't spend a day or two by studying nothing. Atleast study for an hour or two . First clear your concepts property and then solve the type of questions that come in boards . Ask doubts 'n' no of times to your teachers or friends . Don't be ashamed to do so even if u are scholded or told stupid etc .Don't think that your questions is silly and ppl will laugh at u . Be thorough with the last 10–15 yrs question paper . Give some them as full test seriously keeping in mind time management . And then self evaluate yourself . Don't stress yourself if u are getting bad marks initially . Practice makes a man perfect . If marks haven't improved then practice more and more and at the end all the efforts will definitely will be fruitful and u will pass with flying colours . Relax and try to be tension free before exam ( ik it's difficult ) . Try to reach way before time in exam centre and eat and sleep properly before the exams . These things actually matter a lot. Lastly boards exams are easy and there are countless students who come up with 90+ marks so u can also achieve it.

You can surely score more than 90 percent in 12 class boards even if you are not able to make it in 11 class. But it could be possible only if you was quite good in studies till your matric. If you were, then the reason for your poor performance in 11 could only be the abrupt rise in syllabus or more freedom from parents in 11 class or you might have’nt paid attention as 11 class scores are not of much importance. I got 95% in my 12 class CBSE board exams in non-med. Stream, but in 11 i just passed on the verge. The reasons for my poor performance were many. 1.i got much freedom from my parents after shifting in higher secondaries.2.Lack of proper guidance that what to do after +2. and the main reason 3. I got 10 CGPA in 10th and i thought that if i had done this,then i can do any thing,quitea carelessness. But then i got quite serious for studies after 11 results. So i think you can make a comeback in board results if you do regular studies and from depth of your heart, which is quite important. Also 3–4 hours of self study is quite important for making it to more than 90%.

Hi Dude,first of all the question you should ask yourself is that why you couldn't study in class 11. It is definitely possible to score well in class 12 because as everybody says that nothing is impossible but if this is true then you won’t have been asking this question now if it was really true. everything is possible but only in it’s own time so if that voice really comes out of your head and heart that yes i have to study for my own sake and not anybody else then none of these answers would matter to you and you’d shut your phone off and start studying. So,think that whatever you are doing,is it really something your own self wants from yourself or you are doing it just for the sake of doing it. take care dude.

of course you can. i scored less in my freshman year but that motivated me to give my best in the senior year. i actually doubled my percentage in sr year. what i did was :- change the way i handled various subjectsstarted to prepare as if my exams are next day since the start of the sessionchanged my approach towards science subjects from theoretical to practical and solved as many questions as i can everyday.the thing that really helped me a lot was going for e-tuitions rather than a home tutor. there are many websites offering online tuition but Online Tuition | eTuition | Online Tutoring | eTutoring | TutStu helped me a lot regarding this.TutStu has a unique open-sourced global marketplace displaying number of tutors who are competent and expert in handling students of different curriculum and syllabi . the fact that the tutors are almost always online for their students, aided me. Options such as live chat with audio and video makes the interfacing very smooth and seamless. i could ask help from them at the last minutes and they cleared my doubts efficiently. To choose a tutor suiting my needs was my call to make and i did it after a FREE demo first trial which made my judgement very easy.

Yes off-course you can. Although its true that class 11 sets a base for class 12th but you still can score your desired marks provided you are ready to work hard. Start early so that you have sufficient time for revision before exams. Concentrate in your classes because getting the basics right is very important to score good marks. First study from your textbooks thoroughly, make your own notes. But for clarity of concepts take help from reference books. I would recommend you to study from Oswaal Question Bank. This book is updated and include more than sufficient questions to be exam-ready. Some of the benefits of studying from this book are: Features like Chapter wise and Topic-wise presentation strengthen knowledge and attitude related to the subject. .2. Quick Review in the beginning of each chapter is an added advantage of using this book. 3. Questions incorporated in this book encompass all the ‘Typologies’ for exam-oriented study. 4. Previous Years’ Board Questions are also included in the book, which you should definitely solve to familiarize yourself with the exam-pattern. After completing your syllabus make sure to solve sample papers 2–3 months before exam. Solve oswaal sample question papers. They include 5 solved question papers and 10 self-assessment papers with hints covering important concepts from an examination perspective. It also include on tip notes, answering tips, commonly made errors and mind maps for quick revision and better retention. Just study methodically through out the year and scoring 90+ will be a cake walk for you. Hope this helps!

Hi ! My percentages were as follows in school Class 9 - 7 cgpa Class 10 - 7.6 cgpa Class 11 - 58.8% Class 12 Boards - 93% Does anyone care what you scored before class 12 ? NO. It's all about the hardwork you put in and the choices you make Any person can a score a decent percentage. “If you want to become something you are not, start doing something that you don't.” It doesn't matter what you score in school exams, all that matters is your Board Exam at least in the long run. I never ever saw 90+ marks next to my name back in school, but I made the wonder happen. :') Good luck Vaishak

Hey! I scored 73% in 11th and 91.8% in not that high but my parents were satisfied and it was comparable to the Sharma ji ‘s kid living next door, so I feel I am eligible to answer this question. So in simple words ‘Yes ‘ you can definitely do well. The reason there might have been a drop I your grades might be because of the sudden increase in the syllabus which you are not used to as 10th Standard was pretty chill. So give yourself time , study on a regular basis and you will definitely do well. All the best ! :)

To get 90 plus in 12th standard ,you have work hard and give your 100% to it. Nothing is impossible in life.Keep your electronic gadgets away ,make a proper schedule regarding which topics to cover when and follow it. Try to understand the subject and then mug it up as some words are important. Solve sample and previous years question papers,and don't do selective studying.Follow the suggestions given by your teachers and also collect selection examination’s question papers of different schools .

Yes there are chances to get good results in plus2 without studying much in plus1 Because 12th syllabus is easier than 11th syllabus so you can score well ,there is no doubt in it. But remember that,for c.e.t you need to have overall knowledge of 11th and 12th syllabus. So it will be very difficult to face c.e.t without 11th base.Already now if you have finished your 11th no problem and just concentrate on 12th,after finishing your 12th board exam one month gap will be given for the entrance exams such as kcet etc. That time you have to go through 11th syllabus , then only you can do well in c.e.t. C.e.t plays an important role in getting colleges for your precious dream courses so one should not neglect it from the beginning itself. Very sure that ,easily you can score in 12th theory exams even without the good base of 11th. But for entrance exams really you need to work hard in order to get good ranks and good colleges.

Honestly saying I cannot gaurentee a 90+ but I can make sure that you put in 100% effort and you get a 100% result. Simple place your books in the west south west zone of your house and see how easily you understand, grasp and remember everything you read. And make sure that direction is clutter free and clean. Approach a vastu expert if you do not know the technique of finding accurate directions.

Yes ofcourse there must be no doubt regarding this I myself got 68%in class 11(PCMB) and able to get 90%in class 12 board exam this year .and please the motivation you are having at early class 12 must be continued throughout the year. What I noticed in my time period that in starting all students are serious regarding there studies score well in early test but soon after they loss all there enthusiasm and resulting in less score Best of luck for your boards this year

Yes Bro U Can.. I am the biggest example of this. I am Fail in the 11th Class Don't know what happens with. My parents request the principal to pass me nd principal do that after that incident I study hard and get 97.8% marks in 12th class. U can do this if you have any motive behind it.Which gives u motivation nd a charge up when u fill lazy.. Best of luck U can do this.. Nothing is impossible.

I am a physics teacher and I have many examples where students who did badly in eleventh and even could not cross 40% in their pre board, got more than 95% in the board. There is nothing in 12th physics that can not be learnt in just three months. Study regularly. Practice by writing is the key. Learning physics is like learning a guitar. The more you practice, the more you become the master of the field.

Sure…. If you didn’t study well in class 11 it wiil not effect on your class 12 th result…..but you have to study well in class 12 from the 1st class….. Study on regular basis and do practice after class….. And study well …. Then definitely you will be able to get a good result….. All the best …..

Yes ofcourse! Learning properly the things thought in PU 2 will actually count in getting 90+ in your board exams. But not surely on entrance exams because entrance contains both of PU1 and PU2. Well if you are only concern of obtaining 90+ in board, PU 1 doesn't count! But a bit basics for all subjects can be obtained from PU1. Learn for knowledge and Enjoy learning, All the very Best!!! :)

Yes, Why not. There is very little connection in 11 & 12 as you’ll see the advancement of few topics but overall you can easily score more than 90. I have done this earlier. You just have to focus on your syllabus and practice (Complete NCERTs) NCERT books are the keys to score 90+ as most of the questions are direct from NCERTs Good luck and have faith in you

Sure you can get it.. Practice makes the man perfect! I repeated my +1 and got 75% in +2 (tho I was having science). You just need to practice hard. Make a good time table work accordingly and give time to your studies as well! You just need to work hard and try to avoid using phones and laptops sacrifice it. Just for one complete year try it and you will do really very well! Good luck :)

If you're in ISC it's absolutely possible. But you need to work really hard since you missed out on the basics. Good Luck. I scored 89% in 11th and 95.5% in my boards that too when I got 83% in my pre boards. So if you believe you can then you can. Don't lose hope and keep hustling.

Offcourse you can .. Just plan and execute your day well .. Look back not for feeling guilty for not studying earlier but to learn from your past mistakes .. Time management is very important .. self study is the best .. And remember always you will get what you attract .so choose wisely . Good luck !!

The answer is a big YES . I would just like to say that PERSISTENCE CAN CHANGE FAILURE INTO EXTRAORDINARY ACHIEVEMENTS . Just be regular keep small aims for say each day should have an aim . Every night just see what u did in day and check what was not useful . All the best !!!

Yes you can. Try to concentrate from the very beginning of the year.you will face few problems but you can do it,Try to solve sample papers of last few years. And be regular to class. Listen attentively to the teachers.This will definitely help you. Thank you.

Yes. Its never too late..! Being a college student i think i can answer this question. Your 11th marks really dont matter if you are a CBSE student. However.. if u are a state board student.. even if it matters to an extent… if u study hard u can always get. Give atleast 5 to 6hours after school . Prepare notes which may help you in your final boards. Be confident and write your xams well. All the best :)

Yes it's sure that you can get 90+ but A bIt of rivision or a brief study of important topica is essential at the begining of 12th. You have to revise both 11th and 12th inorder to get academic excellence in the coming years for the sake of common admission tests. The more you prepare and revise, the better is your further studies.
yes you can…but one one condition…You have to work hard from day one…learn to forget the stuffs that did’nt go well in class 11…and focus on what you are doing right now. :) all the best
Yes ! But you have to work hard for it because in Physics and Chemistry the concepts that are taught in 11th are used for 12th standard problems and text
Yeah sure. You can score well in class 12 if your 11th didn't go well. You just have to put extra focus on topics which require the concepts from 11th syllabus. All the best!

I have only one thing to say….”Hardwork”-It has no alternative…U can achieve everything…Work hard…follow Ncert with a gud and experienced teachers….use google effienctly for instant help…nd frame a routine….Thats all u could do….nd ur hardworkd will b bestowed…. All the best…Hope u succeed
if u have that much caliber to take all the difficulties at a time u can get surely.but i think it as a facing risk.
Yes. Because 12 th standard marks are independent. Do well. Exceptionally well actually haha.. Because its tough to get 90+
This question is like : can a plant grow strong without strong roots ? Dear you have to make your base strong to move ahead to next level.Skipping a ladder while climbing may lead to injury.
Obviously bro!! All you need to focus on writing skills along with content….go with NCERT and you will be getting more than 90 .
No never because 11th is the base of 12th,if you haven't studyed in 11th you will not get 90% in 12th.
Yes , no matter what you have scored in 11th
For around 2 to 3 months study syllabus of class Xi also Work hard and don't adopt shortcuts. …
No
No
